news.title: BBC may not be in 'safe hands' under its chair, says committee head
news.summary: The most senior MP on the culture select committee says Samir Shah's evidence to MPs was "wishy-washy".

news.title: BBC chairman survives MPs' questions – but crisis at corporation is not over
news.summary: BBC chairman Samir Shah appears to strengthen his position during questioning by MPs, our media editor says.

news.title: Has Britain's budget watchdog become too all-powerful?
news.summary: Ahead of this week's Budget, some have accused the Office for Budget Responsibility of being a "straitjacket on growth"

news.title: 'We earn £60,000 and want stamp duty scrapped'
news.summary: BBC News hears from people with a range of incomes about what they want to see in the Budget.

news.title: 'Gang in balaclavas targeted our combine harvester': Farmers welcome rural crime crackdown
news.summary: Police launch a new nationwide strategy to crack down on organised crime gangs in the countryside.

news.title: Family reunited after a decade – now a Trump clampdown could tear them apart
news.summary: Marven's mother and sister could be sent back to gang-ravaged Haiti as a US protection scheme ends.

news.title: Controversial US-backed Gaza Humanitarian Foundation ends aid operations
news.summary: Hundreds of Palestinians were killed while seeking food amid chaotic scenes near GHF's sites.

news.title: Two climbers die after fall on New Zealand's highest peak
news.summary: Hikes to the summit of Mount Cook are known to be challenging even for experienced climbers.

news.title: Too many female abuse victims are locked up, says minister as BBC visits women's prison
news.summary: As the government seeks to reduce the prison population, the BBC visits HMP Send to meet inmates.

news.title: The Papers: Labour MPs urged to 'unite for Budget' and '1,000 abuse victims safer'
news.summary: Speculation about what will be in Chancellor Rachel Reeves' Budget eve generate many of the headlines.
